Text: Financial Sector (Collection of Data) (reporting standard) determination No. 10 of 2022  Reporting Standard ARS 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the official title of the determination and the specific reporting standard it establishes.

Text: I, Alison Bliss, delegate of APRA, under paragraph 13(1)(a) of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001 (the Act) and subsection 33(3) of the Acts Interpretation Act 1901:
Interpretation/Simplification: Identifies Alison Bliss as an APRA delegate, acting under specific sections of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001 and the Acts Interpretation Act 1901 to issue this determination.

Text: revoke Financial Sector (Collection of Data) (reporting standard) determination No. 36 of 2021, including Reporting Standard ARS 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance made under that Determination; and
Compliance To be Done: Revoke Financial Sector (Collection of Data) (reporting standard) determination No. 36 of 2021 and its associated Reporting Standard ARS 743.0.
Last Date of Compliance: Upon registration on the Federal Register of Legislation
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA is officially cancelling a previous reporting standard, Determination No. 36 of 2021, along with the version of Reporting Standard ARS 743.0 that was part of it.

Text: determine Reporting Standard ARS 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance, in the form set out in the Schedule, which applies to the financial sector entities to the extent provided in paragraph 4 of the reporting standard.
Compliance To be Done: Establish a new Reporting Standard ARS 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance, detailed in the Schedule, applicable as specified in paragraph 4.
Last Date of Compliance: Upon registration on the Federal Register of Legislation
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA is officially putting into effect a new Reporting Standard ARS 743.0, as detailed in the attached Schedule. This standard applies to financial sector entities as explained in its paragraph 4.

Text: Under section 15 of the Act, I declare that the reporting standard shall begin to apply to those financial sector entities, and the revoked reporting standard shall cease to apply, on the day it is registered on the Federal Register of Legislation.
Last Date of Compliance: On the day it is registered on the Federal Register of Legislation
Interpretation/Simplification: The new reporting standard comes into effect and the old one ceases on the date this instrument is officially registered with the Federal Register of Legislation.

Text: This instrument commences upon registration on the Federal Register of Legislation.
Last Date of Compliance: Upon registration on the Federal Register of Legislation
Interpretation/Simplification: This legal document becomes active once it is formally recorded in the Federal Register of Legislation.

Text: Dated: 23 February 2022
Interpretation/Simplification: The date on which the determination was signed.

Text: Alison Bliss General Manager Data Analytics & Insights Division
Interpretation/Simplification: Identifies the person who signed the determination (Alison Bliss) and her official role within APRA.

Text: March 2022 ARS 743.0 - 1
Interpretation/Simplification: Standard page numbering and document identifier.

Text: Reporting Standard ARS 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance
Interpretation/Simplification: The formal title of the specific reporting standard being detailed.

Text: This Reporting Standard outlines the requirements for the provision of information to APRA relating to an authorised deposit-taking institution’s or registered financial corporation’s provision of housing finance to households. It includes Reporting Form ARF 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance and the associated specific instructions.
Interpretation/Simplification: This standard details how banks (ADIs) and financial corporations (RFCs) must report data on housing loans to households to APRA, specifying the form (ARF 743.0) and instructions to use.

Text: This Reporting Standard is made under section 13 of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001.
Interpretation/Simplification: This reporting standard is legally issued under Section 13 of the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001.

Text: Information collected by Reporting Form ARF 743.0 ABS/RBA Housing Finance (ARF 743.0) is used by the ABS and RBA for various purposes, including statistical publications. This information may also be used by APRA for prudential and publication purposes.
Interpretation/Simplification: The data collected through Form ARF 743.0 is primarily for statistical use by the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) and the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA), and also for APRA's regulatory oversight and public reporting.

Text: This Reporting Standard is an Economic and Financial Statistics (EFS) Reporting Standard for the purposes of Reporting Standard ARS 701.0 ABS/RBA Definitions for the EFS Collection (ARS 701.0).
Interpretation/Simplification: This reporting standard is categorized as an Economic and Financial Statistics (EFS) standard, and entities should refer to ARS 701.0 for relevant definitions.

Text: This Reporting Standard applies to an authorised deposit-taking institution (ADI) or registered financial corporation (RFC) as set out in the table below, where ‘housing credit’ is measured by the values reported in item 1.1.1.1.1 (column 1) and item 2.1 (column 3) on Reporting Form ARF 720.1A/B ABS/RBA Loans and Finance Leases (Standard)/(Reduced) (ARF 720.1A/B). Class of financial institution Applicable ADIs Yes if total housing credit ≥ $3 billion. RFCs Yes if total housing credit ≥ $3 billion.
Interpretation/Simplification: This reporting standard applies to banks (ADIs) and registered financial corporations (RFCs) if their total housing credit, as reported in Form ARF 720.1A/B, is equal to or exceeds $3 billion.

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the official identifier and registration date of the authorized version of the document (repeated).

Text: March 2022 ARS 743.0 - 2
Interpretation/Simplification: Standard page numbering and document identifier.

Text: APRA may from time to time determine that a higher threshold will apply to a particular ADI or RFC than that specified in paragraph 4 of this Reporting Standard and if APRA does so it will notify the ADI or RFC concerned in writing.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA has the discretion to set a higher housing credit threshold than $3 billion for specific banks or financial corporations, and will communicate any such change to the affected entity in writing.

Text: This Reporting Standard applies for reporting periods ending on or after 31 March 2022.
Last Date of Compliance: 31 March 2022 (for reporting periods ending on or after)
Interpretation/Simplification: The reporting requirements of this standard apply to all reporting periods that conclude on or after March 31, 2022.

Text: An ADI or RFC to which this Reporting Standard applies must provide APRA with the information required by this Reporting Standard for each reporting period on a domestic books consolidation.
Interpretation/Simplification: If your institution (ADI or RFC) falls under this standard, you must submit the required data to APRA for every reporting period, based on your domestic financial records.

Text: The information required by this Reporting Standard must be given to APRA in electronic format using an electronic method available on APRA’s website or by a method notified by APRA prior to submission.
Interpretation/Simplification: All required data must be submitted electronically, either through APRA's website or via another method communicated by APRA before submission.

Text: The information required by this Reporting Standard must be provided in respect of each calendar month by an ADI or RFC to which this Reporting Standard applies under paragraphs 4 or 5.
Interpretation/Simplification: Covered institutions must submit the required information monthly, for each calendar month.

Text: The information required by this Reporting Standard must be provided to APRA within 10 business days after the end of the reporting period to which the information relates.
Last Date of Compliance: Within 10 business days after the end of the reporting period
Interpretation/Simplification: Monthly reports are due to APRA within 10 business days following the end of the calendar month they cover.

Text: APRA may, by notice in writing, change the reporting periods, or specified reporting periods, for a particular ADI or RFC, to require it to provide the information required by this Reporting Standard more frequently, or less frequently, having regard to: (a) the particular circumstances of the ADI or RFC; and (b) the extent to which the information is required for the purposes of the ABS or RBA.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA can, in writing, alter the reporting frequency (making it more or less often) for a specific institution, considering that institution's unique situation and the data needs of the ABS or RBA.

Text: APRA may grant an ADI or RFC an extension of a due date, in writing, in which case the new due date for the provision of the information will be the date on the notice of extension.
Interpretation/Simplification: APRA can approve requests for extensions to reporting deadlines for ADIs or RFCs, and the new deadline will be specified in a written notice from APRA.

Text: All information provided by an ADI or RFC under this Reporting Standard must be the product of systems, processes and controls that have been reviewed and tested by the external auditor of the ADI or RFC as set out in Prudential Standard APS 310 Audit and Related Matters for ADIs or Reporting Standard RRS 710.0 ABS/RBA Audit Requirements for Registered Financial Corporations for RFCs. Relevant standards and guidance statements issued by the Auditing and Assurance Standards Board provide information on the scope and nature of the review and testing required from external auditors. This review and testing must be done on an annual basis or more frequently if required by the external auditor to enable the external auditor to form an opinion on the accuracy and reliability of the information provided by an ADI or RFC under this Reporting Standard.
Finance / Internal Audit / External Audit / Compliance
Last Date of Compliance: Annually (or more frequently if required by external auditor)
Interpretation/Simplification: The data submitted must come from systems and processes that have been audited and tested by your external auditor at least annually (or more often if the auditor deems necessary), in line with specific audit standards (APS 310 for ADIs or RRS 710.0 for RFCs), to ensure the data is accurate and reliable.

Text: All information provided by an ADI or RFC under this Reporting Standard must be subject to systems, processes and controls developed by the ADI or RFC for the internal review and authorisation of that information. These systems, processes and controls are to assure the completeness and reliability of the information provided.
Interpretation/Simplification: Institutions must establish internal systems and controls to review and authorize all data submitted under this standard, ensuring the data is complete and dependable.

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This is the official identifier and registration date of the authorized version of the document (repeated).

Text: March 2022 ARS 743.0 - 3
Interpretation/Simplification: Standard page numbering and document identifier.

Text: When an officer or agent of an ADI or RFC submits information under this Reporting Standard and uses a method notified by APRA, it will be necessary for the officer or agent to digitally sign the relevant information using a digital certificate or other digital identity credential acceptable to APRA.
Interpretation/Simplification: Any data submitted to APRA must be digitally signed by an authorized employee or representative of the institution using a digital certificate or identity approved by APRA.

Text: Terms that are defined in ARS 701.0 appear in bold and italics in this Reporting Standard.
Interpretation/Simplification: Words or phrases defined in Reporting Standard ARS 701.0 will be formatted in bold and italics when used in this document.

Text: In this Reporting Standard: due date means the last day of the 10 business days provided for in paragraph 10 or, if applicable, the date on a notice of extension given under paragraph 12. reporting period means a month of a year as provided for in paragraph 9 or, if applicable, the date on a notice given under paragraph 11.
Interpretation/Simplification: Defines 'due date' as 10 business days after the reporting period or a new date if an extension is granted. Defines 'reporting period' as a calendar month or a period adjusted by APRA.

Text: Unless the contrary intention appears, any reference to an Act, Prudential Standard, Reporting Standard, Australian Accounting or Auditing Standard is a reference to the instrument as in force or existing from time to time.
Interpretation/Simplification: Unless stated otherwise, any mention of laws, prudential standards, reporting standards, or accounting/auditing standards refers to their most current version.

Text:
These instructions assist completion of ARF 743.0. ARF 743.0 collects information relating 
to the provision of finance to households for housing purposes by ADIs and RFCs.  
Information reported in ARF 743.0 is required primarily for purposes of the ABS and the 
RBA. This information is required for various purposes, including policy and statistical 
purposes. Published aggregate statistics from this collection are used for research and policy 
formulation by a range of interested parties, including economists, State and Federal 
Governments, and the private sector. Information reported in ARF 743.0 may also be used by 
APRA for prudential and publication purposes.
Interpretation/Simplification: These instructions guide the completion of ARF 743.0, which gathers data on housing finance provided to households by financial institutions (ADIs and RFCs) for statistical, policy, prudential, and publication purposes by ABS, RBA, and APRA.

Text: Reporting level
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section defining who needs to report.

Text:
ARF 743.0 must be completed by each ADI and RFC to which this Reporting Standard 
applies under paragraphs 4 or 5.
Interpretation/Simplification: All Authorised Deposit-taking Institutions (ADIs) and Registered Financial Corporations (RFCs) that fall under paragraphs 4 or 5 of this Reporting Standard are required to complete ARF 743.0.

Section: Reporting basis and unit of measurement
Text: Reporting basis and unit of measurement
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section detailing how data should be reported and its units of measure.

Section: Reporting basis and unit of measurement
Text:
These instructions specify the reporting basis and unit of measurement that applies to each 
item.
Interpretation/Simplification: The following sections will outline the specific reporting methods and measurement units for each data field.

Section: Reporting basis and unit of measurement
Text: For reporting purposes, unless specified otherwise, enter data as a positive number.
Interpretation/Simplification: Unless specifically told otherwise, all numerical data entered must be positive.

Text: Location
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on reporting by geographical location.

Text:
When reporting by location, report according to the location of the residential property that 
the finance will be used for, not the location of the collateral (where this differs) or the 
location where the commitment was made.
Interpretation/Simplification: The location for reporting must be the actual address of the residential property being financed, not where the collateral is located or where the loan was originated.

Text: Counterparties
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on defining and classifying counterparties.

Text: For the purposes of this form, report only finance to households for housing purposes.
Interpretation/Simplification: This form is exclusively for reporting finance provided to households specifically for housing-related purposes.

Text:
For the purposes of this form, households may exist in either the resident or non-resident 
sectors.
Interpretation/Simplification: Households, for reporting on this form, can be either residents of Australia or non-residents.

Text: Positions with resident and non-resident households are collected separately.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data pertaining to resident households and non-resident households must be reported in distinct categories.

Text: Types of finance
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on the different types of finance to be reported.

Text: For the purposes of this form, finance includes loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: For this form, the term 'finance' encompasses all types of loans.

Text:
When reporting applications and borrower-accepter commitments, report only that finance 
where the legal lender on the contract is an entity included in the domestic books 
consolidation of the ADI or RFC.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting loan applications and accepted commitments, only include finance where the lending entity is part of the ADI's or RFC's domestic consolidated accounts.

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This document is an authorized version registered on March 1, 2022.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 2
Interpretation/Simplification: Page identifier for the instructions document, page 2, dated March 2022.

Text:
When reporting information on the stock of outstanding finance (e.g. credit outstanding), 
only include finance that is held on-balance sheet, unless otherwise directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting outstanding finance, only include those amounts that are recorded on the institution's balance sheet, unless specific instructions state otherwise.

Text: Reporting by purpose
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on classifying finance based on its purpose.

Text:
Classify finance at the lowest level at which it is able to be identified; the purpose that the 
funds will be used for determines whether (and where) it is reported on this form. Where 
finance (identified at the lowest available level) is to be used for more than one purpose, 
classify that finance to its predominant purpose (based on the purpose for which the largest 
share of the funds will be used).
Interpretation/Simplification: Categorize finance as precisely as possible based on its intended use. If a single finance amount has multiple purposes, classify it under the main (largest) purpose.

Text: Credit outstanding
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on reporting the amount of credit that is still owed.

Text:
Report outstanding finance under the category in which it sits as at the reporting date. For 
example, if a loan was originally classified as having a fixed interest rate but now has a 
variable interest rate then it must be reported as variable interest rate for the current 
reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report all outstanding finance based on its current classification or status on the reporting date, not its original classification (e.g., a fixed-rate loan that has become variable should be reported as variable).

Text: Treatment of facilities
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for instructions on how to handle various types of finance facilities.

Text:
Where there is a finance facility with a mix of interest rate or repayment types, follow the 
instructions below, unless otherwise directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: If a finance facility has multiple interest rates or repayment types, follow the subsequent specific instructions, unless given alternate directions.

Text:
When reporting on the number of facilities, report each facility once. Where interest rate 
types or repayment types are separately identified, report the number of facilities according to 
the predominant interest rate type or repayment type by value.
Interpretation/Simplification: Count each finance facility only once. If a facility has a mix of interest rates or repayment types, categorize it based on the type that accounts for the largest portion of its value.

Text:
When reporting the value of finance, apportion across the relevant interest rate type and/or 
repayment type dimensions.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting the monetary value of finance, distribute it appropriately across the different interest rate types and repayment types that apply.

Text: Values
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on how to report monetary values.

Text:
Unless otherwise specifically stated, information reported on this form must comply with 
Australian Accounting Standards.
Interpretation/Simplification: All financial data reported on this form must adhere to Australian Accounting Standards, unless specific exceptions are explicitly mentioned.

Text:
Report monetary amounts on ARF 743.0 in Australian dollars or the Australian dollar 
equivalent of the foreign currency. Amounts denominated in foreign currency are to be 
converted to AUD in accordance with AASB 121 The Effects of Changes in Foreign 
Exchange Rates (AASB 121).
Interpretation/Simplification: All monetary figures in ARF 743.0 must be reported in Australian dollars. Foreign currency amounts must be converted to AUD using the rules set out in AASB 121.

Text: Report values on ARF 743.0 as whole dollars.
Interpretation/Simplification: All monetary values reported on ARF 743.0 should be rounded to the nearest whole dollar.

Text: Numbers
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on how to report non-monetary numerical data.

Text: Report numbers on ARF 743.0 unscaled, as whole numbers for ADIs and RFCs.
Interpretation/Simplification: For ADIs and RFCs, all non-monetary numbers in ARF 743.0 must be reported as their original, unadjusted whole numbers.

Text: Averages
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for the section on how to report average values.

Text: Report averages on ARF 743.0 unscaled, as numbers to two decimal places.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report all average figures in ARF 743.0 in their original, unadjusted form, displayed with exactly two decimal places.

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This document is an authorized version registered on March 1, 2022.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 3
Interpretation/Simplification: Page identifier for the instructions document, page 3, dated March 2022.

Text: Standard Business Reporting (SBR)
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for information related to Standard Business Reporting (SBR), a system for standardized reporting to government agencies.

Text:
The accounting type (i.e. credit or debit) is stated for all monetary items and represents 
the natural accounting balance of the item collected.
Interpretation/Simplification: Each monetary item specifies whether it's a credit or debit, reflecting its normal accounting balance.

Text: Specific instructions
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for detailed, item-by-item instructions for completing the form.

Text:
Terms highlighted in bold italics are defined in Reporting Standard ARS 701.0 ABS/RBA 
Definitions for the EFS Collection (ARS 701.0).
Interpretation/Simplification: Any terms shown in bold italics within this document have their definitions provided in Reporting Standard ARS 701.0.

Text:
All derived fields in the form are shaded in grey and are explained in words as a 
mathematical expression in these instructions.
Interpretation/Simplification: Fields on the form that are shaded grey are calculated, and their calculation methods are described mathematically in these instructions.

Text:
Examples included under ‘Include’ and ‘Exclude’ must not be taken as an exhaustive list of 
items to be included or excluded.
Interpretation/Simplification: The examples provided for inclusion or exclusion are illustrative, not a complete list of all items.

Text:
1. 
New applications for housing loans
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for reporting on new applications received for housing loans.

Text:
Item 1 collects information on the number and value of applications for housing loans by 
households for housing purposes during the reporting period, by property purpose and 
interest rate type.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1 requires data on the count and monetary value of housing loan applications from households during the reporting period, categorized by the property's purpose and the loan's interest rate type.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 1 as during the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: All data for Item 1 must reflect activities that occurred within the specified reporting period.

Text: Data for resident and non-resident households are collected separately.
Interpretation/Simplification: Applications from resident households and non-resident households must be reported in separate categories.

Text:
Include all genuine applications for finance. Exclude applications for pre-approval of 
finance.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only include actual, finalized applications for finance; do not include requests for pre-approval of finance.

Text:
Include applications for internal refinancing and external refinancing. Record an 
application as received in the reporting period the application was able to be assessed.
Last Date of Compliance: Reporting period when able to be assessed
Interpretation/Simplification: Report both internal and external refinancing applications. An application is considered 'received' in the reporting period when it was ready for evaluation.

Text: Column 1
Interpretation/Simplification: Refers to instructions for data entry in Column 1 of the report.

Text: Report the total number of applications for loan facilities.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total count of loan facility applications.
Interpretation/Simplification: Enter the cumulative number of all loan facility applications received.

Text: Column 2
Interpretation/Simplification: Refers to instructions for data entry in Column 2 of the report.

Text: Report the value of applications.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total monetary value of applications.
Interpretation/Simplification: Enter the cumulative monetary value of all applications received.

Text: SBR: submit column 2 with accounting type debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting via Standard Business Reporting (SBR), ensure that data in Column 2 is categorized as a debit (asset) type.

Text:
Item 1.1 
 
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report housing finance applications from resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report all applications from resident households that are seeking finance for housing purposes.

Text:
Item 1.1 is a derived item. Report applications received from resident 
households for finance for the purpose of housing in item 1.1 as the sum 
of item 1.1.1 and item 1.1.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1.1 is a calculated field; its value is the total of Item 1.1.1 and Item 1.1.2.

Text:
Item 1.1.1 
 
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of owner-occupied housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report applications from resident households for owner-occupied housing finance.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report applications from resident households for finance intended for homes they will live in themselves.

Text:
Item 1.1.1 is a derived item. Report applications received from resident 
households for finance for the purpose of owner-occupied housing in 
item 1.1.1 as the sum of item 1.1.1.1 and item 1.1.1.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1.1.1 is a calculated field; its value is the total of Item 1.1.1.1 and Item 1.1.1.2.

Text:
Item 1.1.1.1  
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of owner-occupied housing with a fixed interest rate.
Compliance To be Done: Report fixed-rate owner-occupied housing finance applications from resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report applications from resident households for owner-occupied housing finance that feature a fixed interest rate.

Text:
Item 1.1.1.2  
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of owner-occupied housing with a variable interest rate.
Compliance To be Done: Report variable-rate owner-occupied housing finance applications from resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report applications from resident households for owner-occupied housing finance that feature a variable interest rate.

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This document is an authorized version registered on March 1, 2022.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 4
Interpretation/Simplification: Page identifier for the instructions document, page 4, dated March 2022.

Text:
Item 1.1.2 
 
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of investment housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report applications from resident households for investment housing finance.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report applications from resident households for finance intended for properties held as investments.

Text:
Item 1.1.2 is a derived item. Report applications received from resident 
households for finance for the purpose of investment housing in 
item 1.1.2 as the sum of item 1.1.2.1 and item 1.1.2.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 1.1.2 is a calculated field; its value is the total of Item 1.1.2.1 and Item 1.1.2.2.

Text:
Item 1.1.2.1  
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of investment housing with a fixed interest rate.
Compliance To be Done: Report fixed-rate investment housing finance applications from resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report applications from resident households for investment housing finance that feature a fixed interest rate.

Text:
Item 1.1.2.2  
Report applications received from resident households for finance for the 
purpose of investment housing with a variable interest rate.
Compliance To be Done: Report variable-rate investment housing finance applications from resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report applications from resident households for investment housing finance that feature a variable interest rate.

Text:
Item 1.2 
 
Report applications received from non-resident households for finance 
for the purpose of housing (both owner-occupied and investment).
Compliance To be Done: Report housing finance applications from non-resident households (owner-occupied and investment).
Interpretation/Simplification: Report all applications from non-resident households for housing finance, covering both owner-occupied and investment property purposes.

Sub-section: New borrower accepted-commitments for housing loans – by location and purpose
Text:
2. 
New borrower accepted-commitments for housing loans – by location and 
purpose
Interpretation/Simplification: Header for reporting new housing loan commitments accepted by borrowers, categorized by the property's location and the loan's purpose.

Text:
Item 2 collects information on the number and value of new borrower-accepted 
commitments for housing finance made to households during the reporting period, by the 
location of the residential property that the finance is used for, the purpose sub-class of the 
commitment and the property purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 2 requires data on the count and value of new housing finance commitments accepted by households during the reporting period, broken down by property location, commitment sub-purpose, and property purpose.

Text:
Borrower-accepted commitments include agreements to increase the credit limit of an 
existing loan contract (for example, as part of an internal refinance). For a borrower-
accepted commitment, the credit limit is the maximum amount of funds that will be made 
available to the borrower without additional authorisation or approval. This includes 
outstanding balances (including capitalised interest or fees) and any other funds that can be 
drawn without additional approval by the lender in this amount.
Interpretation/Simplification: Defines 'borrower-accepted commitments' as including credit limit increases on existing loans (e.g., internal refinances). The credit limit is the total amount available to the borrower without further approvals, encompassing outstanding balances and drawable funds.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 2 as during the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: All data for Item 2 must reflect activities that occurred within the specified reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 2 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting via Standard Business Reporting (SBR), ensure that data for Item 2 is categorized as a debit (asset) type.

Text: Data for resident and non-resident households are collected separately.
Interpretation/Simplification: Commitment data for resident households and non-resident households must be reported in separate categories.

Text:
Column 1  
Report according to the location of the residential property that the 
finance is used for (see item 2 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report location based on residential property financed, referring to Item 2 for details.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 1, report the geographical location of the residential property that the finance is funding. Consult Item 2 for more specific guidance.

Text:
Column 2 
Report according to the loan purpose sub-class of the housing finance 
(see item 2 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report loan purpose sub-class of housing finance, referring to Item 2 for details.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 2, report the specific sub-category for the purpose of the housing finance. Refer to Item 2 for more detailed instructions.

Text:
Column 3 
Report according to the property purpose (see item 2 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report property purpose, referring to Item 2 for details.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 3, report whether the property is for owner-occupied or investment purposes. Refer to Item 2 for specific guidance.

Text:
Column 4 
Report the total number of new facilities for the purpose of housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total count of new housing finance facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: Enter the total number of new finance facilities established for housing purposes.

Text:
Column 5 
Report the total value of new borrower-accepted commitments for 
finance for the purpose housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total monetary value of new borrower-accepted housing finance commitments.
Interpretation/Simplification: Enter the total monetary value of all new housing finance commitments that have been accepted by borrowers.

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This document is an authorized version registered on March 1, 2022.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 5
Interpretation/Simplification: Page identifier for the instructions document, page 5, dated March 2022.

Text:
Item 2  
Report new housing borrower-accepted commitments to residents for 
each combination of location, loan purpose sub-class, and property 
purpose.
Compliance To be Done: Report new housing commitments to residents, broken down by location, loan purpose, and property purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: Provide detailed reports on new housing loan commitments accepted by residents, categorizing each by the property's location, the specific loan purpose, and whether the property is for owner-occupation or investment.
This lists the specific geographical categories (Australian states, territories, and overseas) that must be used for reporting location data.

Text:
The loan purpose sub-classes of borrower-accepted commitments for 
housing are: 
 
finance for the purchase of residential land.  Include only those 
borrower-accepted commitments that do not also include finance 
for the construction of a new dwelling or purchase of an existing 
dwelling on that land;
Interpretation/Simplification: One loan purpose sub-class is 'finance for residential land purchase.' Only include commitments strictly for purchasing land, excluding those that also finance construction or an existing dwelling on that land.

Text:
 
finance for the construction of new dwellings. Include borrower-
accepted commitments that provide finance for the construction of 
a new dwelling and the purchase of the land together;
Interpretation/Simplification: Another loan purpose sub-class is 'finance for new dwelling construction.' This category should include commitments that cover both the construction of a new home and the purchase of the land it sits on.

Text:
 
finance for the purchase of newly erected dwellings;
Interpretation/Simplification: Another loan purpose sub-class is 'finance for purchasing homes that have been recently built.'

Text:
 
finance for the purchase of existing dwellings. Exclude borrower-
accepted commitments for the purpose of refinancing (discharging) 
existing loans. Report these as either internal refinancing or 
external refinancing;
Interpretation/Simplification: Another loan purpose sub-class is 'finance for purchasing existing homes.' Do not include refinancing of existing loans in this category; instead, report those separately as internal or external refinancing.

Text:
 
finance for alterations, additions and repairs to residential 
property. Report only borrower-accepted commitments where 
alterations, additions and repairs is the predominant loan purpose;
Interpretation/Simplification: Another loan purpose sub-class is 'finance for alterations, additions, and repairs to residential property.' Only report commitments where this is clearly the primary purpose of the loan.

Text:
 
finance to be used to refinance an existing housing loan with an 
institution that other than the reporting institution (external 
refinancing). Report the total value of the new borrower-accepted 
commitment; and
Interpretation/Simplification: One loan purpose sub-class is 'external refinancing,' which involves refinancing an existing housing loan with a different institution. Report the full value of the new accepted commitment for such loans.

Text:
 
finance where an existing loan with the ADI or RFC has been 
refinanced (internal refinancing). Report the total value of the new 
borrower-accepted commitment. Exclude all loans that have been 
refinanced for the purpose of a purchase, construction or any other 
alterations, additions and repairs, or other improvements on a 
different residential property. Report these in the appropriate item 
above.
Interpretation/Simplification: Another loan purpose sub-class is 'internal refinancing,' where an existing loan with the same ADI or RFC is refinanced. Report the full value of the new accepted commitment. Do not include internal refinances that are actually for a new purchase, construction, or improvements on a different property; these should be reported under their respective categories.

Text:
The property purposes are: 
 
owner-occupied; and 
 
investment.
Interpretation/Simplification: The two categories for classifying property purpose are 'owner-occupied' (where the owner lives) and 'investment' (held for rental income or capital gain).

Text: Authorised Version F2022L00214 registered 01/03/2022
Interpretation/Simplification: This document is an authorized version registered on March 1, 2022.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 6
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the reporting instruction manual and page number for March 2022.

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for finance for the 
purposes of housing to resident households.
Compliance To be Done: Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for housing finance to resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of all new home loan agreements that resident households have accepted.

Text:
Item 2.1 is a derived item. Report total borrower-accepted commitments 
to resident households for the purpose of housing in item 2.1 as the sum 
of item 2.1.1 and item 2.1.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 2.1 is calculated by adding the figures reported in item 2.1.1 (owner-occupied) and item 2.1.2 (investment housing) for resident households.

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for finance for the 
purpose of owner-occupied housing to resident households.
Compliance To be Done: Report new borrower-accepted commitments for owner-occupied housing to resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of new home loan agreements accepted by resident households where the property is for owner-occupation.

Text:
Item 2.1.1 is a derived item. Report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to resident households for the purpose of owner-occupied 
housing for each column in item 2.1.1 as the sum of all combinations of 
residential property location categories and loan purpose sub-classes 
reported for owner-occupied housing finance in the corresponding 
column in item 2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 2.1.1 is calculated by summing all relevant categories of residential property location and loan purpose sub-classes from Item 2 that pertain to owner-occupied housing finance for resident households.

Text:
Of the amount reported in item 2.1.1, report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to residents for the purpose of owner-occupied housing 
where foreign-sourced income was used in the ADI’s or RFC’s 
serviceability assessment of the application.
Compliance To be Done: Report a subset of item 2.1.1: new commitments for owner-occupied housing to residents where foreign-sourced income was used for serviceability assessment.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total reported in item 2.1.1, you must specifically report the portion of new owner-occupied housing commitments to residents where the borrower's ability to repay was assessed using income from foreign sources.

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for finance for the 
purpose of investment housing to resident households.
Compliance To be Done: Report new borrower-accepted commitments for investment housing to resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of new home loan agreements accepted by resident households where the property is for investment.

Text:
Item 2.1.2 is a derived item. Report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to resident households for the purpose of investment 
housing for each column in item 2.1.2 as the sum of all combinations of 
residential property location categories and loan purpose sub-classes 
reported for investment housing finance in the corresponding column in 
item 2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 2.1.2 is calculated by summing all relevant categories of residential property location and loan purpose sub-classes from Item 2 that pertain to investment housing finance for resident households.

Text:
Of the amount reported in item 2.1.2, report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to residents for investment housing loans where foreign- 
sourced income was used in the ADI’s or RFC’s serviceability 
assessment of the application.
Compliance To be Done: Report a subset of item 2.1.2: new commitments for investment housing to residents where foreign-sourced income was used for serviceability assessment.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total reported in item 2.1.2, you must specifically report the portion of new investment housing commitments to residents where the borrower's ability to repay was assessed using income from foreign sources.

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments to non-residents for 
the purpose of housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report total new borrower-accepted commitments to non-residents for housing.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of all new home loan agreements that non-resident households have accepted.

Text:
Do not report borrower-accepted commitments to non-residents by 
location and/or purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting non-resident commitments, do not break down the data by property location or loan purpose.

Text:
Of the amount reported in item 2.2, report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to non-residents for the purpose of housing where foreign- 
sourced income was used in the ADI’s or RFC’s serviceability 
assessment of the application.
Compliance To be Done: Report a subset of item 2.2: new commitments to non-residents for housing where foreign-sourced income was used for serviceability assessment.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total reported in item 2.2, you must specifically report the portion of new housing commitments to non-residents where the borrower's ability to repay was assessed using income from foreign sources.

Text:
3. 
New borrower-accepted commitments for housing loans to resident first-
home buyers – by location
Interpretation/Simplification: This section outlines reporting requirements for new housing loan commitments accepted by resident first-home buyers, broken down by property location.

Text:
Item 3 collects information on the number and value of new borrower-accepted 
commitments for housing finance made to resident first-home buyers  during the reporting 
period, by the location of the residential property that the finance is used for and property 
purpose (owner-occupied or investment).
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 3 requires collecting data on both the count and total value of new housing loan commitments made to resident first-home buyers during the reporting period, categorized by the property's location and whether it's for owner-occupation or investment.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 7
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the reporting instruction manual and page number for March 2022.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 3 as during the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 3 should cover activities that occurred throughout the entire reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 3 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 3 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 3 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text: Include resident households. Exclude non-resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report data for resident households; do not include data for non-resident households.

Text:
Exclude internal refinancing and external refinancing of loans that were initially extended 
to first-home buyers. These must be reported in item 2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include refinancing of existing loans for first-home buyers in this item; such refinancing should be reported under Item 2 instead.

Text:
Report according to the location of the residential property that the 
finance is used for (see item 3 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report Column 1 data based on the residential property's location.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Column 1, categorize and report the data based on where the residential property is located.

Text: Report according to the property purpose (see item 3 for further details).
Compliance To be Done: Report Column 2 data based on the property's purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Column 2, categorize and report the data based on the property's intended use (owner-occupied or investment).

Text:
Report the total number of new facilities for finance for the purpose of 
housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total number of new housing finance facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 3, provide the overall count of new housing loan facilities established.

Text:
Report the total value of new borrower-accepted commitments for the 
purpose of housing.
Compliance To be Done: Report the total value of new borrower-accepted commitments for housing.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 4, provide the total monetary value of new housing loan commitments that have been accepted by borrowers.

Text:
Report new borrower-accepted commitments to resident first-home 
buyers for each combination of location and property purpose.
Compliance To be Done: Report new commitments to resident first-home buyers, categorized by location and property purpose.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Item 3, you must report all new loan commitments accepted by resident first-home buyers, breaking down the data by both the property's location and its intended use (owner-occupied or investment).
These are the specific geographical regions and territories to be used when categorizing and reporting property locations.

Text:
The property purposes are: 
 
owner-occupied; and 
 
investment.
Interpretation/Simplification: These are the two classifications for how a property is used: either the owner lives in it (owner-occupied) or it is used for investment purposes (e.g., rented out).

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for finance for the 
purposes of housing to resident first-home buyers.
Compliance To be Done: Report total new commitments for housing to resident first-home buyers.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the overall total value of new home loan agreements accepted by resident first-home buyers.

Text:
Item 3.1 is a derived item. Report total borrower-accepted commitments 
to resident first-home buyers for the purpose of housing in item 3.1 as 
the sum of item 3.1.1 and item 3.1.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 3.1 is calculated by adding the figures reported in item 3.1.1 (owner-occupied) and item 3.1.2 (investment housing) for resident first-home buyers.

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for finance for the 
purpose of owner-occupied housing to resident first-home buyers.
Compliance To be Done: Report new commitments for owner-occupied housing to resident first-home buyers.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of new home loan agreements accepted by resident first-home buyers where the property is for owner-occupation.

Text:
Item 3.1.1 is a derived item. Report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to resident first-home buyers for the purpose of owner- 
occupied housing for each column in item 3.1.1 as the sum of all 
combinations of residential property location categories reported for 
owner-occupied housing finance in item 3.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 3.1.1 is calculated by summing all relevant residential property location categories from Item 3 that pertain to owner-occupied housing finance for resident first-home buyers.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 8
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the reporting instruction manual and page number for March 2022.

Text:
Of the amount reported in item 3.1.1, report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to resident first-home buyers for the purpose of owner- 
occupied housing where foreign-sourced income was used in the ADI’s 
or RFC’s serviceability assessment of the application.
Compliance To be Done: Report a subset of item 3.1.1: new commitments for owner-occupied housing to resident first-home buyers where foreign-sourced income was used for serviceability assessment.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total reported in item 3.1.1, you must specifically report the portion of new owner-occupied housing commitments to resident first-home buyers where the borrower's ability to repay was assessed using income from foreign sources.

Text:
Report total new borrower-accepted commitments for finance for the 
purpose of investment housing to resident first-home buyers.
Compliance To be Done: Report new commitments for investment housing to resident first-home buyers.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of new home loan agreements accepted by resident first-home buyers where the property is for investment.

Text:
Item 3.1.2 is a derived item. Report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to resident first-home buyers for the purpose of investment 
housing for each column in item 3.1.2 as the sum of all combinations of 
residential property location categories reported for investment housing 
finance in the corresponding column in item 3.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 3.1.2 is calculated by summing all relevant residential property location categories from Item 3 that pertain to investment housing finance for resident first-home buyers.

Text:
Of the amount reported in item 3.1.2, report total new borrower-accepted 
commitments to resident first-home buyers for investment housing loans 
where foreign-sourced income was used in the ADI’s or RFC’s 
serviceability assessment of the application.
Compliance To be Done: Report a subset of item 3.1.2: new commitments for investment housing to resident first-home buyers where foreign-sourced income was used for serviceability assessment.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total reported in item 3.1.2, you must specifically report the portion of new investment housing commitments to resident first-home buyers where the borrower's ability to repay was assessed using income from foreign sources.

Text:
4. 
Revolving housing loans to residents
Interpretation/Simplification: This section outlines reporting requirements for revolving credit facilities (like lines of credit) for housing loans provided to resident households.

Text:
Item 4 collects information on the credit limits for revolving credit facilities for housing 
finance made available to resident households from reporting period to reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 4 requires collecting data on the maximum credit limits for revolving housing loans offered to resident households, tracking changes from one reporting period to the next.

Text:
Borrower-accepted commitments include agreements to increase the credit limit of an 
existing loan contract (for example, as part of an internal refinance).
Interpretation/Simplification: The term 'borrower-accepted commitments' also covers agreements where the credit limit on an existing loan is increased, such as during a refinancing process.

Text: For a borrower-accepted commitment, the credit limit is the maximum amount of funds that will be made available to the borrower without additional authorisation or approval.
Interpretation/Simplification: The credit limit is the maximum amount of money a borrower can access or draw without needing further approval from the lender.

Text:
This includes outstanding balances (including capitalised interest or fees) and any other funds that can be 
drawn without additional approval by the lender in this amount.
Interpretation/Simplification: The credit limit comprises both the current amount owed (including any accrued interest or fees added to the loan balance) and any other funds that are immediately available for the borrower to draw without needing new approval.

Text:
Reporting basis: report item 4 as at the end of the reporting period or during the reporting 
period as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 4 should be reported either as a snapshot at the close of the reporting period or covering activities throughout the reporting period, as specified by further directives.

Text: Include resident households. Exclude non-resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only include data from resident households; do not include data from non-resident households.

Text: Include revolving credit facilities. Exclude fixed-term finance.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report revolving credit facilities (e.g., lines of credit); do not include standard fixed-term loans in this item.

Text:
Report credit limits and credit outstanding in the category in which they sit as at the 
reporting date.
Interpretation/Simplification: Ensure that both available credit limits and outstanding credit amounts are reported under their correct classification as of the reporting date.

Text: Report the value for owner-occupied housing loans.
Compliance To be Done: Report value for owner-occupied housing loans in Column 1.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 1, report the monetary value specifically for loans where the property is owner-occupied.

Text: Report the value for investment housing loans.
Compliance To be Done: Report value for investment housing loans in Column 2.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 2, report the monetary value specifically for loans where the property is for investment.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 9
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the reporting instruction manual and page number for March 2022.

Text:
Report new credit limits committed to and accepted by resident 
households for revolving credit facilities during the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report new accepted credit limits for revolving facilities to resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total value of all new revolving credit limits that resident households have committed to and accepted during the reporting period.

Text:
Include the value of credit limits for new borrower-accepted 
commitments for the purpose of internal refinance and external 
refinance.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting new credit limits, you must also include those that result from new borrower-accepted commitments for internal or external refinancing.

Text: SBR: submit item 4.1 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 4.1 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 4.1 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text:
Report cancellations of and reductions in resident households’ previously 
committed revolving credit limits during the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report cancellations and reductions in resident households' revolving credit limits.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report any instances where resident households' previously agreed-upon revolving credit limits were cancelled or reduced during the reporting period.

Text:
Include the value of credit limits cancelled during the reporting period 
due to an internal refinance or external refinance.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting cancelled credit limits, include those that were cancelled specifically because of an internal or external refinancing process.

Text:
Exclude repayments that reduce the used portion of the revolving credit 
facility, but not the total credit available.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include regular loan repayments that only decrease the amount used on a revolving credit facility, as long as the total available credit limit remains unchanged.

Text: SBR: submit item 4.2 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 4.2 data via SBR, categorizing it as a credit (negative asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 4.2 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'credit' as a 'negative asset'.

Text:
Report total credit limits available to resident households (including 
credit outstanding) as at the end of the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report total available credit limits to resident households, including outstanding amounts, at period end.
Interpretation/Simplification: At the end of the reporting period, you must report the total revolving credit limits available to resident households, which includes any amounts already drawn down and currently outstanding.

Text: SBR: submit item 4.3 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 4.3 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 4.3 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text:
5. 
Fixed-term housing loans to residents – stocks and flows reconciliation
Interpretation/Simplification: This section outlines the process for reconciling changes in the outstanding balances of fixed-term housing loans provided to resident households.

Text:
Item 5 provides a reconciliation of changes in the outstanding balance of fixed-term housing 
loans to resident households that are held on-balance sheet over the reporting period. It does 
this by beginning with the previous reporting period’s closing balance for loans, and then 
accounting for the movement over the reporting period by identifying the components due to 
new drawdowns, interest, repayments and other adjustments.
Interpretation/Simplification: Item 5 describes how to track and report changes in the total outstanding amount of fixed-term housing loans to resident households on the balance sheet. This involves starting with the previous period's closing balance and then accounting for new loans, interest, repayments, and other adjustments during the current period.

Text:
Reporting basis: report item 5 as at the end of the reporting period or during the reporting 
period as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: Data for Item 5 should be reported either as a snapshot at the close of the reporting period or covering activities throughout the reporting period, as specified by further directives.

Text: Include resident households. Exclude non-resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only include data from resident households; do not include data from non-resident households.

Text: Include fixed-term loans. Exclude revolving credit.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report fixed-term loans; do not include revolving credit facilities (like lines of credit) in this item.

Text:
Report credit limits and credit outstanding in the category in which they sit as at the 
reporting date.
Interpretation/Simplification: Ensure that both available credit limits and outstanding credit amounts are reported under their correct classification as of the reporting date.

Text:
For any changes between owner-occupied and investment loans: 
 
the outstanding closing balance must reflect all loans in their correct category as at the 
end of the reporting period;
Interpretation/Simplification: If a loan's purpose changes (e.g., from owner-occupied to investment), its final outstanding balance at the end of the reporting period must be recorded under its correct, new category.

Text:
the entire value of any flow items attributable to that loan during the reporting period 
must be reported in the category that the loan finished the reporting period in;
Interpretation/Simplification: Any transactions (like new drawdowns or repayments) related to a loan must be reported in the category (owner-occupied or investment) that the loan held at the end of the reporting period, even if its purpose changed mid-period.

Text:
the opening balance (the closing balance at the end of the previous reporting period) of 
any loans that switched property purpose during the reporting period must be treated as 
a negative value in its old category and a positive value in its new category, 
contributing to a net flow into each category to be calculated and recorded at item 5.12.
Interpretation/Simplification: If a loan's purpose changed during the period, its opening balance should be recorded as a negative amount in its original category and a positive amount in its new category. This adjustment contributes to the net flow calculated for each category in Item 5.12.

Text: Report the value for owner-occupied housing loans.
Compliance To be Done: Report value for owner-occupied housing loans in Column 1.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 1, report the monetary value specifically for loans where the property is owner-occupied.

Text: Report the value for investment housing loans.
Compliance To be Done: Report value for investment housing loans in Column 2.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 2, report the monetary value specifically for loans where the property is for investment.

Text:
March 2022 
 
ARF 743.0 Instructions - 10
Interpretation/Simplification: This is a document header indicating the reporting instruction manual and page number for March 2022.

Text:
Report credit outstanding for the stock of fixed-term housing loans to 
resident households as at the end of the previous reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report outstanding credit for fixed-term housing loans to resident households from the previous period.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the total outstanding amount of fixed-term housing loans to resident households as it stood at the end of the previous reporting period.

Text: This item equals item 5.14 as reported in the previous reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: The value reported for Item 5.1 in the current period must match the value reported for Item 5.14 in the immediately preceding reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.1 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.1 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.1 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text:
Report all amounts drawn down on fixed-term housing loans to resident 
households newly funded during the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report newly funded drawdowns on fixed-term housing loans to resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report all amounts drawn by resident households from fixed-term housing loans that were newly funded during the current reporting period.

Text:
Where the loan is disbursed over a period of time (as for a loan for 
construction purposes), include only the portion newly drawn in each 
reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: For loans disbursed in installments (e.g., construction loans), only report the specific amount drawn during the current reporting period, not the full approved loan amount.

Text:
Include drawdowns where: 
 
the loan is an internal refinance; and 
 
the loan is an external refinance.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must include drawdowns from both internal and external refinancing activities when reporting for this item.

Text:
Exclude drawdowns from redraw facilities on existing fixed-term loans 
during the reporting period. Report these in item 5.3.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include funds drawn from redraw facilities on existing fixed-term loans in this item; these must be reported separately under Item 5.3.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.2 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.2 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.2 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text:
Report all other loan amounts drawn down during the reporting period 
that are not recorded in item 5.2.
Compliance To be Done: Report all other loan drawdowns not included in 5.2.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report all other loan amounts drawn during the reporting period that were not already accounted for in Item 5.2.

Text:
Include drawdowns from redraw facilities on existing fixed-term loans 
during the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Specifically include any funds drawn from redraw facilities on existing fixed-term loans within this item.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.3 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.3 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.3 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text:
Report the credit sold during the reporting period (excluding any 
premium or discount).
Compliance To be Done: Report credit sold during the period, excluding premium/discount.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the face value of any credit (loans) that was sold during the reporting period, without including any additional premiums or deducting any discounts from the sale price.

Text:
Only include loans that are no longer recorded as being on-balance sheet 
as a result of this sale.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only include loan sales where the loans have been removed from your balance sheet as a direct result of the sale.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.4.1 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.4.1 data via SBR, categorizing it as a credit (negative asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.4.1 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'credit' as a 'negative asset'.

Text:
Of the amount reported at item 5.4, report loans that are no longer 
recorded on-balance sheet because they were classified as off-balance 
sheet securitised during the reporting period.
Compliance To be Done: Report securitized off-balance sheet loans from item 5.4.
Interpretation/Simplification: From the total amount of credit sold (Item 5.4), specifically report those loans that were removed from the balance sheet because they were securitized and moved off-balance sheet during the reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.4.1 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.4.1 data via SBR, categorizing it as a credit (negative asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.4.1 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'credit' as a 'negative asset'.

Text:
Report the credit purchased during the reporting period (excluding any 
premium or discount).
Compliance To be Done: Report credit purchased during the period, excluding premium/discount.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the face value of any credit (loans) that was purchased during the reporting period, without including any additional premiums or deducting any discounts from the purchase price.

Text:
Include loans that were not previously recorded as being on-balance sheet 
but are now recorded as on-balance sheet as a result of the purchase of 
credit.
Interpretation/Simplification: Include loans that were not on your balance sheet before but are now on-balance sheet due to their purchase.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.5 with accounting type of debit (asset).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.5 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.5 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text:
Report the interest charged by the lender on outstanding loan balances 
during the reporting period, whether or not it is actually received from the 
borrower. Report this amount in accordance with Australian Accounting 
Standards.
Compliance To be Done: Report interest charged on outstanding loan balances, per Australian Accounting Standards.
Interpretation/Simplification: You must report the interest accrued by the lender on all outstanding loan balances during the reporting period, irrespective of whether the borrower has actually paid it yet. This reporting must comply with Australian Accounting Standards.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.6 with accounting type of debit (asset).
Compliance To be Done: Submit item 5.6 data via SBR, categorizing it as a debit (asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting Item 5.6 data through the SBR system, ensure it is classified with an accounting type of 'debit' as an 'asset'.

Text: Report the total (interest and other charges plus principal as applicable) repayments due during the reporting period in accordance with the loan conditions, whether or not the payments were actually received from the borrower (scheduled repayments). This is the contracted, agreed or minimum repayment amount.
Interpretation/Simplification: For each loan, report the scheduled repayment amount for the period, even if not received. This is the agreed minimum payment.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.7 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.7 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the total value of loans, net of scheduled repayments that are repaid in full during the reporting period due to the discharge of the loan. Include repayments due to: internal refinance; external refinance; and final repayments.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total value of loans fully paid off during the period, including those due to refinancing or final payments, after deducting scheduled repayments.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.8 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.8 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the value of any other excess repayments over the reporting period for each loan that made excess repayments over the reporting period. To be calculated at the loan level. Include payments into redraw facilities. Exclude: loans for which scheduled repayments exceeded actual repayments (i.e. payment deficiencies). Report these in item 5.10; loans that were repaid in full during the reporting period due to the discharge of the loan. Report these in item 5.8; and payments into offset accounts. Report these on ARF 747.0A/B ABS/RBA Deposits Stocks, Flows and Interest Rates (Standard)/(Reduced) (ARF 747.0A/B).
Interpretation/Simplification: For each loan, report any payments received that are *more* than the scheduled repayment, including payments into redraw facilities. Do not include payment deficiencies (report in 5.10), fully repaid loans (report in 5.8), or payments into offset accounts (report in ARF 747.0A/B).

Text: SBR: submit item 5.9 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.9 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the sum of the amounts by which scheduled repayments (interest and other charges plus principal as applicable) exceeded actual repayments for each loan where repayments were deficient over the reporting period. Calculate this at the loan level. Exclude loans that did not record a payment deficiency.
Interpretation/Simplification: For each loan with a payment deficiency, report the amount by which the scheduled repayment was higher than the actual repayment. Only include loans with a deficiency.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.10 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.10 via SBR, use 'debit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the value of loans written off during the reporting period less the amount recovered during the reporting period from any previously written-off loans. Exclude amounts recovered through sales of collateral.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the net value of loans written off during the period, subtracting any recoveries from previously written-off loans (excluding collateral sales).

Text: SBR: submit item 5.11 with accounting type of credit (negative assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.11 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Record the net value as at the end of the previous reporting period of any loans that switched between owner-occupied and investment in the current reporting period. In each column, report the net value of loans that have moved into each category.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the net value of loans that changed classification between 'owner-occupied' and 'investment' property types, using their value from the end of the *previous* reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.12 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.12 via SBR, use 'debit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report any other adjustments to the outstanding loan balance during the reporting period that are not reported in items 5.2 to 5.12. Include changes due to exchange rate valuation adjustments for foreign-currency-denominated loans, fees associated with the loan that are not paid by the borrower and which are instead capitalised against the loan balance during the current reporting period, changes in the purpose class of the loan, and changes due to write-offs or write-backs in the previous reporting period or during the reporting period etc. Exclude adjustments arising from the switching of loans between owner-occupied and investment. Report these at item 5.12. Item 5.13 is a derived item. Report any other adjustments to the outstanding loan balance during the reporting period that are not reported in items 5.2 to 5.12 as item 5.14 less: the sum of items 5.1 to 5.3 inclusive, item 5.5, item 5.6, item 5.10 and item 5.12; plus the sum of item 5.4, item 5.7 to item 5.9 inclusive and item 5.11. Report item 5.13 as a positive or negative number as appropriate.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report all other changes to outstanding loan balances not covered by items 5.2 to 5.12, such as currency revaluations, capitalised fees, or purpose changes. This item is derived by a specific calculation involving other report items and can be positive or negative. Do not include owner-occupied/investment switches (see 5.12).

Text: SBR: submit item 5.13 with accounting type of debit (assets). For example, for an increase to the stock of credit outstanding report as a positive value.
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.13 via SBR, use 'debit' as the accounting type. An increase in credit outstanding should be reported as a positive value.

Text: Report credit outstanding for the stock of fixed-term housing loans to resident households as at the end of the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total outstanding balance of fixed-term housing loans provided to resident households at the end of the reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 5.14 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 5.14 via SBR, use 'debit' as the accounting type.

Text: 6. Fixed-term housing loans outstanding to residents – offset accounts, redraw facilities and excess repayments
Interpretation/Simplification: Section title for reporting on balances in offset accounts, redraw facilities, and excess repayments for fixed-term housing loans to residents.
