Text: Item 6 provides information on the balances in offset accounts attached to housing loans, on available redraw balances and on any other accumulated excess repayments that can be used to meet future scheduled repayments on housing loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: This section explains what kind of information Item 6 covers, specifically related to housing loan offset accounts, redraw facilities, and excess repayments.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 6 as at the end of the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: For all items within Section 6, the reported data should reflect the balances as they stand at the close of the reporting period.

Text: Include resident households. Exclude non-resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report on housing loans to resident households; do not include non-resident households.

Text: Include fixed-term loans. Exclude revolving credit loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report on fixed-term housing loans; do not include revolving credit loans.

Text: Report outstanding loans according to the property purpose category in which they sit as at the reporting date.
Interpretation/Simplification: Categorize loans based on their property purpose (e.g., owner-occupied, investment) as of the reporting date.

Text: Exclude loans (and any linked offset accounts or redraw facilities) that are 90 days or more past-due or non-performing as at the end of the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include loans, or their associated offset/redraw facilities, that are 90 days or more overdue or are classified as non-performing.

Text: Column 1 Report the number of facilities or the value of balances associated with owner-occupied housing loans as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Column 1, report the count of facilities or the value of balances specifically for owner-occupied housing loans, as specified by the instructions.

Text: Column 2 Report the number of facilities or the value of balances associated with investment housing loans as directed.
Interpretation/Simplification: For Column 2, report the count of facilities or the value of balances specifically for investment housing loans, as specified by the instructions.

Text: Report the gross balance in all deposit accounts that are offset against the balance of an outstanding housing loan when calculating the interest owing (value of offset accounts).
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total balance in all deposit accounts used as offsets against housing loans for interest calculation purposes.

Text: SBR: submit item 6.1 with accounting type of credit (liability).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 6.1 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the number of housing loan facilities outstanding as at the end of the reporting period with an offset account attached to them (regardless of whether there is a positive value in the offset account). In the case of loans with a mix of interest rate or repayment types, report each facility once; do not report individual facilities with more than one interest rate type or repayment type as multiple facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: Count and report the total number of housing loan facilities that have an attached offset account as of the reporting period end, counting each facility only once even if it has mixed interest/repayment types.

Text: Report the total value of accumulated excess (advance) repayments in redraw facilities as at the end of the reporting period that are accessible to households at a later date. This item represents the maximum amount of redraw balances that could be drawn down without bringing the balance of the loan account above that specified in the loan schedule.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total amount of extra payments held in redraw facilities at the end of the reporting period that borrowers can access, up to the original loan schedule limit.

Text: SBR: submit item 6.3 with accounting type credit (negative asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 6.3 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the number of housing loan facilities outstanding as at the end of the reporting period with a redraw facility attached to them (regardless of whether there are any available funds in the redraw facility). In the case of loans with a mix of interest rates or repayment types, report each facility once; do not report individual facilities with more than one interest rate type or repayment type as multiple facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: Count and report the total number of housing loan facilities that include a redraw facility as of the reporting period end, counting each facility only once even if it has mixed interest/repayment types.

Text: Report the total value of accumulated excess (advance) repayments not in redraw facilities as at the end of the reporting period that are accessible to households at a later date to meet future scheduled repayments. This item represents the maximum amount that could be drawn down without bringing the balance of the loan account above that specified in the loan schedule.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total value of excess repayments *not* in redraw facilities that borrowers can access later to cover future payments, up to the original loan schedule limit.

Text: SBR: submit item 6.5 with accounting type credit (negative asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 6.5 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: Report the total gross balances in any offset accounts linked to housing loans and the total value of accumulated excess repayments that can be used to meet future scheduled repayments (whether in redraw facilities or not). Item 6.6 is a derived item. Report item 6.6 as the sum of item 6.1, item 6.3, and item 6.5.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the total of all offset account balances plus all accumulated excess repayments (from both redraw and non-redraw facilities). This value is calculated by summing items 6.1, 6.3, and 6.5.

Text: SBR: submit item 6.6 with accounting type credit (negative asset).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 6.6 via SBR, use 'credit' as the accounting type.

Text: 7. Fixed-term housing loans outstanding to residents – future scheduled repayments
Interpretation/Simplification: Section title for reporting on future scheduled repayments for fixed-term housing loans to residents.

Text: Item 7 collects information on the distribution of housing loans by accumulated excess repayments that can be used to meet future scheduled repayments and balances in associated redraw and offset accounts, scaled by the number of monthly scheduled repayments as at the end of the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: This section describes the purpose of Item 7: to gather data on housing loan distribution based on excess repayments, redraw/offset balances, and how many months of scheduled repayments these can cover.

Text: Reporting basis: report item 7 as at the end of the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: For all items within Section 7, the reported data should reflect the balances as they stand at the close of the reporting period.

Text: SBR: submit item 7 with accounting type of debit (assets).
Interpretation/Simplification: When submitting report 7 via SBR, use 'debit' as the accounting type.

Text: Include resident households. Exclude non-resident households.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report on housing loans to resident households; do not include non-resident households.

Text: Include fixed-term loans. Exclude revolving credit loans.
Interpretation/Simplification: Only report on fixed-term housing loans; do not include revolving credit loans.

Text: Report outstanding loans according to the property purpose category in which they sit as at the reporting date.
Interpretation/Simplification: Categorize loans based on their property purpose (e.g., owner-occupied, investment) as of the reporting date.

Text: Exclude loans (and any linked offset accounts or redraw facilities) that are 90 days or more past-due or non-performing as at the end of the reporting period.
Interpretation/Simplification: Do not include loans, or their associated offset/redraw facilities, that are 90 days or more overdue or are classified as non-performing.

Text: Where there is finance with a mix of repayment rate types, follow the instructions below.
Interpretation/Simplification: Introduction to specific reporting rules for loans that have a combination of different repayment rate types (e.g., interest-only and amortising).

Text: 1. When reporting on the number of facilities, it is permissible to report the interest-only and amortising accounts separately (i.e. individual facilities with more than one repayment type may be reported more than once). Note that this treatment differs from the standard treatment applied in other items on this form.
Interpretation/Simplification: Unlike other sections, when reporting the number of facilities under Item 7, if a loan has both interest-only and amortising components, you can report it multiple times, once for each component.

Text: 2. When reporting the value of credit limits, report the amount of the credit limit to which the interest-only repayment structure applies in the interest-only drop-down combinations and report the amount of the credit limit to which the amortising repayment structure applies in the amortising drop-down combinations.
Interpretation/Simplification: When reporting credit limits for mixed repayment type loans, allocate the portion of the credit limit associated with interest-only repayment to the interest-only category, and the portion associated with amortising repayment to the amortising category.

Text: 3. When scaling the stock of accumulated excess repayments and balances in associated redraw and offset accounts (as reported in item 6) by the number of monthly scheduled repayments, attribute the accumulated balances to the repayment structure of the loan account to which they are linked.
Interpretation/Simplification: When calculating how many months of scheduled repayments can be covered by excess funds (from Item 6), assign those funds to the specific repayment type (e.g., interest-only, amortising) they belong to within the loan.

Text: Column 1 Report according to the number of monthly scheduled repayments that the stock of accumulated excess repayments and balances in associated redraw and offset accounts (as reported in item 6) would be sufficient cover at the end of the reporting period. See item 7 for further details.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 1, indicate how many months of future scheduled repayments the total accumulated excess funds (from Item 6) could cover at the end of the reporting period.

Text: Column 2 Report according to the property purpose (see item 7 for further details).
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 2, categorize and report loans based on their property purpose (e.g., owner-occupied, investment).

Text: Column 3 Report according to the loan repayment type (see item 7 for further details).
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 3, categorize and report loans based on their repayment type (e.g., amortising, interest-only).

Text: Column 4 Report the number of fixed-term housing loan facilities.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 4, report the total count of fixed-term housing loan facilities.

Text: Column 5 Report the average facility credit limit available.
Interpretation/Simplification: In Column 5, report the average available credit limit across all facilities.

Text: Report the number of facilities and the average facility credit limit of outstanding housing loans for each combination of number of monthly scheduled repayments categories, property purpose and repayment type. The number of monthly scheduled repayments categories are: >=0 to <=1 month; >1 to <=3 months; >3 to <=6 months; >6 to <=9 months; >9 to <=12 months; >12 to <=24 months; and >24 months. The property purposes are: owner-occupied; and investment. The repayment types are: amortising; and interest-only.
Interpretation/Simplification: Report the count of facilities and their average credit limits, segmented by specific categories for monthly repayment coverage, property purpose (owner-occupied/investment), and repayment type (amortising/interest-only).

Text: Where the frequency of scheduled repayments is not monthly, convert it to monthly and then calculate the equivalent number of monthly repayments.
Interpretation/Simplification: If repayments are not monthly, convert them to a monthly equivalent before calculating the number of monthly repayments covered by excess funds.

Text: Report the average number of monthly scheduled repayments that the stock of accumulated excess repayments and balances in associated redraw and offset accounts (as reported in item 6) would be sufficient to cover for amortising loans reported in item 7.
Interpretation/Simplification: For amortising loans in Item 7, report the average number of months that accumulated excess repayments and offset/redraw balances (from Item 6) would cover for future scheduled payments.

Text: Report the average number of monthly scheduled repayments that the stock of accumulated excess repayments and balances in associated redraw and offset accounts (as reported in item 6) would be sufficient to cover for interest-only loans reported in item 7.
Interpretation/Simplification: For interest-only loans in Item 7, report the average number of months that accumulated excess repayments and offset/redraw balances (from Item 6) would cover for future scheduled payments.
